chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Bee Mann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Of A Firearm By Adjudicated Delinquent, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during the period of probation.  If revoked payable from defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC).  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived costs/fees due to indigency.
-Court set restitution at zero.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time enrollment in school or combination of both.  Obtain GED or HSED.

Court advised defendant that she is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote until her civil rights are restored.
Court advised defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.

Mental health evaluation.  Comply with recommended treatment and take all prescribed medications.
Parenting classes.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Huber release for work and childcare.

charges.descr: Possession Of A  Firearm By Adjudicated Delinquent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Bee Mann

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie Bee Mann in Court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Willie Bee Mann in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Sentencing hearing. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant has FOUR CASES scheduled today for Sentencing: 21CM4102, 21CM2193, 22CF39, and 21CM3952. Court reviewed Character Reference Letters. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of SIX (6) YEARS. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is THREE (3) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is THREE (3) YEARS.  

Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT IMPOSED AND STAYED THE SENTENCE ON COUNT 1, AND PLACED DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF THREE (3) YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION / EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
- AS TO COUNT 1: Serve SEVEN (7) MONTHS CONDITION TIME. 
Huber Release for Work and Childcare. 
- Mental Health Evaluation, comply with recommended treatment and take all prescribed medications. 
- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
- Parenting Classes. 
- Obtain/Maintain Full-Time Employment or Full-Time Enrollment in School, or combination of both.
- Obtain GED or HSED.

Court set Restitution at ZERO. 

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA Sample  and pay DNA Surcharge during the period of Probation. If Revoked, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency.

Court advised Defendant that she is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote until her civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Willie Bee Mann in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Willie Bee Mann in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing.   Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 46 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Willie Bee Mann in Court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Willie Bee Mann in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with CO-DEFENDANTS (Burks 22CF38 and Tucker 22CF40). Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defendant also has numerous cases in Branch 37, which were transferred to Branch 46 for GLOBAL RESOLUTION. Parties confirmed resolution posture. Defense requested a plea/sentencing hearing. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Willie Bee Mann in Court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Willie Bee Mann in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy on behalf of Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Arraignment. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. State filed original Information. Defense waived reading of the Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. Defense is picking up discovery material later today. Court addressed Co-Defendants. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. 
Scheduling Conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 11:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Willie Bee Mann in court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Willie Bee Mann in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State requests an arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Bee Mann not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

TIME CHANGE FOR PRELIMINARY HEARING.  
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 10:00 (co-def @MSDF)
Parties notified via e-mail.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie Bee Mann in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Willie Bee Mann in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie Bee Mann appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
